me-paragraph: Creating not just beautiful but effective design that solves business problems, boosts conversions, and scales easily. I work at the intersection of design, product, and frontend: I understand how products think and how frontend writes, consider metrics, MVP, and development constraints. I think like a user, calculate like a product, and structure like an engineer — turning business goals into clear, logical, and implementable interfaces.
about-efficiency-text: Design that solves tasks, not just looks good. User experience is honed for conversion growth. Focus on speed: MVP, launch, tests — all to quickly understand what works.
about-system-text: Creating design systems that are easy to scale and maintain. I account for technical constraints, understand frontend, and work in a way that doesn’t cause pain for developers.
about-strategy-text: I see the product holistically: from idea and structure to final implementation. I engage at all stages to ensure the result is not random but deliberate and strong.
tools-paragraph:
In my work, I combine analytics, interface thinking, and visual expression.

A project starts with research: I study competitors, conduct interviews, and clarify what’s important to users. Based on this, I build user flows and create a framework for the future interface.

The visual part is implemented through adaptive mockups and interactive prototypes in Figma. At this stage, I actively test hypotheses through user testing — sometimes even roughly, but with a clear goal: to understand where the interface works and where it doesn’t.

If needed, I add animation in After Effects, edit promo videos, or do basic frontend with CSS / Tailwind / Bootstrap to build an MVP. I work with Git and can streamline processes in a team or as a freelancer.
projects-paragraph: Each of these projects is not just a set of screens. They are thoughtful solutions based on user needs, clear logic, and visual expressiveness. I’ve gone through the entire journey: from initial sketches and mistakes to the final pixel and working interface. Each project reflects my approach, my style, and my responsibility for the result.
projects-downloadPage-paragraph: The goal was to increase conversion and update an outdated page. I started from scratch: conducted brief interviews with marketing, identified user needs, gathered UX tasks, and created a mockup. After hallway tests and revisions, I built the final version using Bootstrap 4.
projects-downloadPage-result: A concise interface focused on action and clean visual presentation. The page became clearer and more effective for users.
projects-downloadPage-stats-5: A/B test: new version outperformed the old in 7 out of 8 metrics
projects-registry-paragraph: A section on the Varwin Education website where 3D, VR, and XR projects on various topics — from educational to entertainment — are collected. Previously, users had no place to share their projects; now they can submit them for publication, and others can download them directly. This simplified content access and reduced the manual workload for the sales team. In the future, self-upload functionality will be added.
projects-registry-result: The section simplified access to user projects, reduced manual work, and became the first step toward building a developer community within Varwin.
projects-registry-stats-1: Foundation for forming an active developer community
projects-registry-stats-2: Ability to submit projects for publication
projects-xrms-paragraph: The main mockup with components and prototypes, containing all interface elements needed for visualizing and testing new features in the Varwin XRMS platform. The mockup serves as a basis for discussion, testing, and implementing product changes.
projects-xrms-result: Developers started building interfaces faster thanks to ready-made components and clear prototypes. The mockup reduced revisions and ensured visual consistency.
projects-xrms-stats-1: Accelerated mockup design with reusable components
projects-xrms-stats-2: Prototypes reduced the number of revisions
design-paragraph: Small but carefully crafted works — experiments with composition, typography, and color. Not the main stars of the portfolio, but they reflect attention to detail and the ability to quickly create clear and aesthetic interfaces.
design-varwinMobile-text: Interface for the Varwin mobile app — a solution that allows launching projects directly from a smartphone or headset. I focused on convenient navigation, quick content access, and comfortable use in various scenarios: from presentations to training and tech support.
design-subscout-text: Mobile app for adding and tracking user subscriptions to paid services.
design-baikal-text: Updated landing page for the ‘Time to Hike’ tourism club, offering a trip to Baikal.
design-pioner-text: Updated landing page for a power machinery factory.
